executive_summary: Fantasy sports services provide a variety of fantasy sports game types to consumers, including daily, weekly and season-long fantasy contests. New product offerings and expanded access to services have strengthened revenue for fantasy sports services through the end of 2024. Despite negative economic impacts during COVID-19, fantasy sports services' relative insulation from pandemic-related restrictions and expanding prevalence in the online space ensured growth during the pandemic. Advertising and sponsorships on fantasy sports websites are among the largest drivers of fantasy sports service revenue. Revenue for fantasy sports services is expected to climb at a CAGR of 2.4% to $11.6 billion through the end of 2029.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 ACCELERATES DEMAND FOR ONLINE FANTASY SPORTS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic pushed many consumers toward the online space, particularly since many team sports like basketball and soccer had to temporarily shut down because of pandemic-era restrictions.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Expansion of Advertising Fuels Broad Consumer Exposure to Fantasy Sports
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Boosted total advertising expenditures continue to bolster fantasy sports' exposure to a variety of consumers, particularly as more consumers have access to digital media.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Acceleration of Technology Fuels Large-Scale Industry Demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The continued expansion and adoption of technology have bolstered consumer activity online and grown the industry's target audience.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: EVOLVING ECONOMIC LANDSCAPE SHIFTS DEMAND ACROSS CORE REVENUE STREAMS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: With consumers' economic conditions evolving in light of heightened inflationary pressures, fantasy sports have been able to leverage these changes to their advantage.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: SOCIALIZING OPPORTUNITIES GROW WITH FANTASY SPORTS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: A unique aspect of fantasy sports service providers is the opportunity provided for consumers to socialize and interact with one another while having fun.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: STABILIZING ECONOMIC CONDITIONS POISED TO BOOST GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As economic conditions continue to recover following COVID-19, fantasy sports service providers are set to benefit from enhanced consumer demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: BOOST OF ONLINE ADVERTISING SET TO EXPAND FANTASY SPORTS' EXPOSURE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Moving forward, a core development for fantasy sports service providers is the expansion of online advertising through mediums like TV, computers and mobile devices.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: DIVERSIFICATION OF PRODUCT OFFERING POISED TO ACCELERATE INDUSTRY PRESENCE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The expanded adoption of daily fantasy sports games will propel its presence across various consumer demographics.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: EVOLVING REGULATORY LANDSCAPE IS A CORE DEVELOPMENT FOR THE INDUSTRY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Although fantasy sports services are poised to grow, providers must remain wary of evolving regulations at the federal and state levels surrounding the legalization of gambling services and fantasy sports.

industry_definition: Fantasy sports service providers develop software and market an online platform for multiplayer fantasy sports. Fantasy sports are games where participants act as general managers to build teams that compete with other fantasy owners based on the statistics generated by real individual players or professional teams.

negative_impact_factors: low - steady Barriers To Entry Level

threats: Time spent on leisure and sports

key_trends: Emphasis on customer service fuels steady internal competition.
Push for a diversified information stream enhances complementary services.
The acceleration of technology strengthens fantasy sports service providers' presence.
Improving economic conditions fuel revenue growth.
Two companies own more than a 5.0% share of the market.
Steady demand for daily fantasy sports events boosts the power of established brands.
Steady growth in advertising expenditures boosts providers' presence.
Evolving state regulations fuel fantasy sports service expansion.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment generates revenue among consumers aged 39 and younger.
This market segment generates revenue among consumers aged 40 to 64.
This market segment generates revenue from consumers aged 65 and older.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment generates revenue from the sale of season-long fantasy sports services to consumers.
Daily fantasy services generate revenue from the sale of daily fantasy sports services to consumers.
This segment generates revenue from alternative services like ancillary services.

tier_1_suppliers: Internet Service Providers in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Office Supply Stores in the US
Wireless Telecommunications Carriers in the US
Database, Storage & Backup Software Publishing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The percentage of business conducted online represents the expanding use of the internet by consumers and businesses.

business_locations.location_description: With fantasy sports services favoring regions with higher population concentration, the Southeast was able to capture the largest share of industry presence.
Another core factor for a larger fantasy sports service presence is the prevalence of software engineers and companies.

Although the Great Lakes lacks the physical population compared with other regions, it has highly concentrated centers that provide fantasy sports service establishments with a lucrative customer base.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Unlawful Internet Gambling Enforcement Act, signed into law in 2006, outlawed online gambling sites, with the notable exception of fantasy sports sites.
In 1996, the National Basketball Association (NBA) sued STATS Inc. over their distribution of NBA results without an agreement.
In response to CDC guidance, health and safety regulations were implemented in the United States to discourage public gatherings.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Fantasy sports service providers face some legal barriers due to monitoring state and local regulations.
Most start-up costs focus on acquiring talent to run fantasy sports applications.
There is low differentiation across fantasy sports services' product offerings.

factors_decreased_barrier: As more states legalize gambling, new entrants will have a larger marketplace.

basis_points.basis_description: Many servicers compete for high-quality servicing of their products.
Many fantasy sports servicers continue to offer additional tools like sports news and analytics.

concentration_points.concentration_description: With fantasy sports leagues highly dependent on localized marketplace.
The industry's tight profit is compounded by consistently swelling operating costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Increasing Demand for Software Developers Fuels High Wage Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Heightened demand for qualified software developers ensures providers pay significant wage costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Fantasy sports services are significantly more labor intensive.

volatility_points.volatility_description: User activity spikes during specific sports seasons.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Regulatory Landscape Creates Unpredictability in Fantasy Sports
volatility_points.volatility_description: Fantasy sports' legal status varies widely across regions.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Acceleration of Advanced Technology Strengthens Fantasy Sports Demand
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The advancement of technology in handheld devices provides easy-to-use tools.

FAQs.question: How have changes in individual consumer electronic use changed your operations?
FAQs.answer: Increases in smartphone usage benefit fantasy sports services because they can access sports scores, fantasy scores, and player information.

FAQs.question: Has regulatory scrutiny affected how you target customers?
FAQs.answer: There is regulatory discussion surrounding fantasy sports all the time so fantasy sports services must heavily advertise to consumers.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to rising wages in recent years?
FAQs.answer: Wages have risen in response to a rising need for highly skilled software developers.

FAQs.question: Is your company strategically located in a region that acts to your benefit?
FAQs.answer: Fantasy sports companies can be located anywhere because they offer online products.

FAQs.question: What qualifications do you look for when hiring employees?
FAQs.answer: Software developers employ highly skilled programmers with a specific skill set and a capacity for creativity.
